Is there a reason for not merging this?

The version problem is because the package is old and last release was 3 years ago.

[noblock]

Donâ€™t worry about the 0.2.0 version number.

I think the name of the package is ambiguous.

VML can mean a lot of things. For example, typing VML into Wikipedia redirects to Vector Markup Language.

https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/index.html#Package-naming-guidelines-1

> Avoid jargon. In particular, avoid acronyms unless there is minimal possibility of confusion.
> It's ok to say USA if you're talking about the USA.
> It's not ok to say PMA, even if you're talking about positive mental attitude.

> Err on the side of clarity, even if clarity seems long-winded to you.
> RandomMatrices is a less ambiguous name than RndMat or RMT, even though the latter are shorter.

I would recommend changing the name to something like `IntelVML.jl`.

@StefanKarpinski @KristofferC @fredrikekre What do you think?
If we want to change the name, I prefer something like `VectorMath` or `IntelVectorMath`. Because `VML` is still vague.

I am fine both with `IntelVML` and `IntelVectorMath`. I like the latter better as a descriptive name, the former for brevity.
For MKL `IntelMKL` seems to be preferred, but not sure if we strongly have to be consistent. MKL is more well known than VML in my experience. 
I think I am voting for `IntelVectorMath`

As someone pointed out on slack, Intel seems to say things like "MKL Vector Mathematics functions (VM) " instead of VML, e.g. https://software.intel.com/en-us/node/521751 . So that's another argument for `IntelVectorMath.jl`.

It might be best for us to wait and see what name the MKL package ends up being registered with. I think it is going to end up being `IntelMKL.jl`. But let's wait and see what the final name for that package is, and then we can figure out this package?

- I was not able to load the package (i.e. `import VML` failed). See the CI logs for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

<!-- [noblock] -->

If someone decides to not overload, they should constantly write `IntelVectorMath` for using every function. That doesn't look good to me.

What is your idea?

https://github.com/JuliaMath/VML.jl/pull/28
You can always just write `const VML = IntelVML` or `const VML = IntelVectorMath` at the top of your code.

> 
> 
> You can always just write `const VML = IntelVML` or `const VML = IntelVectorMath` at the top of your code.

Thanks for the suggestion. I did this from inside the package itself!:

https://github.com/JuliaMath/VML.jl/pull/28/commits/a6dc769355d3ab00411ce2da5d5078b28399be3c

I see that the package has been renamed to `IntelVectorMath` on its `master` branch.

I'll close this PR. Once a `JuliaMath` admin as renamed your repo to `JuliaMath/IntelVectorMath.jl`, you can make a new registration.
